intro: Hieracium subfuscatiforme, commonly known as the pale-yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are usually yellow or pale yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Hieracium subfuscatiforme is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
